Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Burner \Burn"er\, n. 1. One who, or that which, burns or sets fire to anything. [1913 Webster]
2. The part of a lamp, gas fixture, etc., where the flame is produced. [1913 Webster]
{Bunsen's burner} (Chem.), see {Bunsen burner}.
{Argand burner}, {Rose burner}, etc. See under {Argand}, {Rose}, etc. [1913 Webster]

burner n 1: an apparatus for burning fuel (or refuse); "a diesel engine is an oil burner" 2: the heating elements of a stove or range on which pots and pans are placed for cooking; "the electric range had one large burner and three smaller one"
